etymologies: late Middle English: from Old French valeriane, from medieval Latin valeriana (herba), apparently the feminine of Valerianus ‘of Valerius’ (a personal name)

definitions: a plant that typically bears clusters of small pink or white flowers. Native to Eurasia, several species have been introduced to North America.

notes.text: Family Valerianaceae: several species, in particular common valerian (Valeriana officinalis), a valued medicinal herb, and the Mediterranean red valerian (Centranthus ruber), grown for its spurred flowers which attract butterflies

shortDefinitions: Eurasian plant which bears clusters of small pink or white flowers

definitions: a drug obtained from the root of common valerian, used as a sedative and antispasmodic.
shortDefinitions: drug obtained from root of common valerian
